page.title: 17THE MEDIA IN GROVE
page.content: In the field of Local Radio,most people appear to select B.B.C.Radio Lincolnshire,of which reception is very good.Lincoln is only 25 miles away and to many villagers is the local shopping centre.During the Autumn of 1985,Commercial Radio is expected to be officially represented in the area,with the extended coverage of Radio Hallam,based in Sheffield.In television,both the East Midland Area and the Northern Area transmissions can be well received.Local preferance,however,is for the BBC North and commercial Yorkshire television programmes.All the people interviewed agreed that in the absence of local entertainment,television was watched almost daily,particularly in winter.Little mention of the Grove area was recorded in the local papers.
